summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 7264, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Nineteenth Avenue, in the City of Seattle, from Jefferson Street to Roy Street, by laying a water main of proper dimensions in said portion of said avenue, together with all the necessary gates, tees, crossings, fire hydrants, and other appurtenances which may be necessary for the reasonable water service and fire protection of said portion of said avenue; and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 said city, approved December 6, 1899."
